fields.title: Medoc - le plus long
fields.description:
42 kilometers, a 6-hour time limit, and some of the best wines in France along the way. This marathon isn‚Äôt a test of endurance - it‚Äôs a test of temptation. Every few kilometers, vineyards offer red wine, cheese, oysters, and steak. Yes, steak! ü•©üç∑
I started with a plan: run first, drink later. That plan didn‚Äôt last long. With every sip, every laugh, and every ridiculous costume around me, I felt the joy of this race

fields.title: Berlin - the home run
fields.description:
Running a marathon is more than just a race. It‚Äôs a journey‚Äîof discipline, of patience, of learning how to trust your body and mind when they want to stop. It‚Äôs the quiet morning runs, the long miles in solitude, the rhythm of your breath becoming a meditation. It‚Äôs the struggle and the joy, the exhaustion and the triumph, the way the finish line feels like both an ending and a beginning.

And running a marathon in Berlin? That‚Äôs something truly special. My home town, with its history and energy, carries you forward. The streets echo with cheering voices, the Brandenburg Gate stands tall 200m before the finish line at 42 kilometers. Each year, when I arrive there, I know: this is what it means to run a marathon. To push, to believe, to keep going‚Äîstep by step, all the way home.

fields.title: San Francisco and California - time of my life
fields.description:
pending four months in San Francisco and California was more than just a professional experience‚Äîit was a time of personal growth, discovery, and fulfillment. I lived in the San Francisco Bay Area with other young professionals, surrounded by entrepreneurs, tech innovators, and creative minds. I explored Silicon Valley, Berkeley and Stanford, the startup world, gaining insights that shaped my thinking and career.

But this time was about more than just work. California gave me space to breathe, to reflect, and to reconnect with myself. The open roads took me north to Vancouver, south to Los Angeles, and into the heart of the state‚Äôs stunning landscapes. Long drives along the Pacific Coast, the towering redwoods, the energy of new people, and the warmth of the sun all gave me a very deep personal fulfillment‚Äîone that still stays with me.

Unfortunately the San Francisco I once knew ‚Äî the city of my dreams ‚Äî has changed during the last years, I feel a sens of regret.

fields.title: Myanmar ‚Äì Exploring Eco-Tourism at Indawgyi Lake
fields.description:
Indawgyi Lake, Myanmar‚Äôs largest freshwater lake, is a place of natural beauty and cultural significance. On my filming trip, I met local communities working to develop eco-friendly tourism that protects the lake and supports sustainable livelihoods.

Balancing conservation and tourism is a challenge. How are people in the region approaching it? Learn about their efforts, hopes, and the impact on daily life.

fields.title: Vietnam - Searching Mystic Saola
fields.description:
Our journey into Vietnam‚Äôs Annamite Range felt like stepping into another world. Thick jungle, small paths, high humidity and the sound of unseen animals all around. We were searching for something almost mythical: the Saola, also known as the Asian unicorn, one of the rarest large mammals on Earth.

I followed a team of dedicated experts who had spent years trying to find traces of this elusive animal. Their precision and determination impressed me. Setting up motion-triggered cameras, tracking clues, and navigating the dense wilderness, they kept going‚Äîdespite not knowing if they would ever see a Saola in their lifetime.

fields.title: Sicily, Italy ‚Äì History, Culture, and Espresso
fields.description: From ancient Greek temples to medieval towns and Baroque cities, Sicily is a place where history comes alive. Traveling its villages and towns, I discovered a mix of cultures that have shaped the island for centuries. Beyond the landmarks, Sicily‚Äôs charm is: the scent of fresh espresso, and the warmth of Italian hospitality. Sicily offers a unique blend of past and present.

fields.title: Taiwan - Has Technology Become the New Religion?
fields.description:
We trust our smartphones, rely on AI, and follow algorithms‚Äîbut have technologies become our modern-day faith? 
On my eye-opening journey to Taiwan, I met visionary innovators who see tech as a promise for a better future‚Äîand skeptics who warn of its hidden dangers. Who's right? And what does it mean for all of us?

fields.title: Malaysia - Energize the World
fields.description: As the global demand for sustainable energy solutions grows, the next generation of innovators is stepping up to the challenge. During my recent filming trip to Malaysia, I had the privilege of meeting impressive young entrepreneurs, visionary startup founders and changemakers who are shaping the future of energy in Malaysia.

fields.title: Antonov An-225 - ride the colossus
fields.description:
The Antonov An-225 Mriya was the biggest aircraft ever built, designed in the Soviet Union, later flying for Ukrainian Antonov Airlines. I had the unique chance to fly on this engineering marvel in 2016, on its cargo mission from Prague in Czech Republic to Perth in Australia. Three days as the only woman on board for days with an all-male crew. What was it like inside? Watch the film! 

Tragically, this legendary plane was destroyed in Russia‚Äôs war against Ukraine, making my experience aboard even more meaningful.

fields.title: China: High-Tech Cities and Stunning Nature
fields.description:
My trip to China started with a private wedding, took me to political Beijing, the economic powerhouse of Shanghai, and the breathtaking Yellow Mountains. 

But what stayed with me the most were the vast, newly built cities, planned by the government‚Äîmodern, efficient, yet strangely soulless. Restaurants looked identical, streets were wide but quiet, and many buildings remained empty, waiting for residents who had not yet arrived (instead of photos, I kept the images of these places only in my memory, more vivid than any picture.) At the same time, each of those cities had a huge high-speed train station - so impressive impressively well-organized, and a sign of China‚Äôs rapid development.

fields.title: Hawaii ‚Äì Where Earth Meets the Stars!
fields.description:
Coming from Europe, the sheer distance to Hawaii was astonishing. Flying over endless ocean for hours, I realized just how remote these islands are ‚Äî isolated in the vast Pacific, far from any continent. The remoteness was striking, but so was the landscape. Lush rainforests, rugged coastlines, and volcanic craters made it clear that nature here follows its own powerful rhythm.

One of the most memorable moments was hiking Mauna Kea, Hawaii‚Äôs highest peak at 4,207 meters. The altitude made every step challenging, but reaching the summit, surrounded by telescopes scanning the universe, was a quiet and surreal experience.

fields.title: Cameroon - Guns for Motorbikes
fields.description:
In Cameroon‚Äôs Korup National Park, local communities have relied on the forest for centuries, including hunting wildlife for food. Legal and moral restrictions alone do not stop the practice, as it remains a key part of their daily lives.

During my filming trip, I joined NGOs working on sustainable forestry and wildlife management, aiming to balance conservation efforts with local needs. Learn about how in my film.

fields.title: Seville - el personal best
fields.description: Running through the beautiful streets of Seville, I pushed my limits‚Äîand it paid off! üèÅ A fantastic race, perfect conditions, and an incredible atmosphere led me to a new personal best! Are you a runner, too? Let‚Äôs connect! Share your marathon goals, training tips, or race experiences, send me a message. Best via LinkedIn. I‚Äôd love to exchange ideas and motivation!
